You can just pay entry and swim at the first level where the main waterfall is but you should get a guide and go up to different levels and do some cliff jumping and see some.smaller waterfalls. ‚Ä¶

Spectacular waterfalls and friendly local guides. Look out for Dave who is a very very good videographer and photographer with some great techniques for the best videos and photos. Also likes to keep everyone safe and using the correct techniques for jumping and walking.

The most beautiful experience I have ever seen in my life!! Amazing tour guides who are expert swimmers and quite literally saved my life when the current was taking me under,  because I was foolish enough to pass up the life vest.  Challenging hike up to the falls! But so so so worth it!!

Definitely a worthwhile experience and also a good way to generate income for the loyal population.

This is definitely worth a visit for those who loves a bit of adventure. There are several layers of waterfalls here. Entrance fee is only 50 pesos. You can leave your bags in the registration area. Shower rooms are available. It's a scenic drive going to the waterfalls. The path is semented. Very easy to navigate.

Great waterfall with five levels of fun. Make sure you help out the locals and hire a guide to take you to all five. We had a local kid named Clifford who helped with the trail as well as taking photos and telling us where the safest places were to jump. Without a guide it's doable but I definitely wouldn't have found the way.

The road to get there is rather easy by scooter except for some parts a bit tricky, but it's totally doable.
